subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Snowden Revelations: Mass Surveillance Exposed
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Snowden Revelations: Mass Surveillance Exposed usable.

hook.text: In 2013, an NSA contractor revealed that the U.S. government was collecting the phone records of millions of Americans.

buildup.text: Edward Snowden leaked thousands of classified documents revealing NSA programs like PRISM and XKeyscore.

discovery.text: PRISM gave the NSA direct access to servers of Google, Facebook, Apple, and Microsoft. XKeyscore searched everything.

twist.text: Tech companies claimed they didn't know. Later, it emerged they had legal obligations to comply â€“ and gag orders.

climax.text: Snowden's leaks forced global debate on surveillance vs. security. He remains in exile in Russia.

punchline.text: One man's leak changed how the world sees its own governments.

quiz.question: What did the NSA's PRISM program do?
options: It accessed data directly from tech company servers
